text: is a Japanese physicist, engineer and inventor. His work focused on semiconductor technology. He won the 2014 Nobel Prize in Physics together with Isamu Akasaki and Shuji Nakamura for "the invention of efficient blue light- emitting diodes which has enabled bright and energy-saving white light sources". ==References== Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese physicists Category:Japanese engineers Category:Japanese inventors Category:Nagoya University alumni Category:Electronic engineers Category:People from Shizuoka Prefecture
title: Hiroshi Amano
